key_points: UK has 'very, very credible' intelligence of an imminent IS attack at Kabul airport.
British foreign ministry advised against travel to Kabul airport due to attack threat.
Intelligence indicates a possible suicide bomb attack by IS militants.
People advised to stay away from the airport and await further instructions.
The threat described as credible, imminent, and lethal by armed forces minister James Heappey.
Large crowds at the airport despite warnings pose a significant concern.
Western nations relying on the Taliban for security outside the airport.
The UK has evacuated over 12,000 people from Afghanistan and plans 11 more flights.
Approximately 400 eligible individuals, mostly British or dual nationals, remain in Afghanistan.
There's a possibility not everyone will be evacuated due to the worsening security situation.
